result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacque K. Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacque K. Turner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacque K. Turner was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Jacque K. Turner was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 11CM73 & 14CF890.  Credit for 67 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling -Mandatory, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.   
*   Pay DNA surcharge.    **DE DOES NOT HAVE TO GIVE DNA SAMPLE
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Latrice B or Jodeci W, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement mailed to Atty Lassiter to get defendant's signature since they were not handed out in court.  Once signed she is to return them to the court.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk; PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Counts 1 & 3 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 18 months with conditions concurrent to 11CM73 & 14CF890.  Credit for 67 days if revoked.  No contact with Latrice B. or Jodeci W.  Any bond on deposit is to be applied between all 3 files.  Appeal Rights given.

NO RECORD TAKEN:    Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Atty Hilary Edwards appears specially for Atty Lassiter who is out ill today.  Plea & Sentencing adj. to 9/18/14 at 3:30 PM due to unavailability of Atty Lassiter.

Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 4-11-14 @ 10:30am with 11CM73. Bond continued.
